title: Thai Spicy Duck Salad Recipe
full_text:
Thai Spicy Duck Salad Recipe
Close
Jump to recipe
Prep
30 mins
Cook
15 mins
Active
45 mins
Total
45 mins
Serves
4 servings
Cook Mode
(Keep screen awake)
Ingredients
2
tablespoons
fresh juice from about 2 limes
1
tablespoon
fish sauce
1/2
teaspoon
sesame oil
1
teaspoon
palm sugar
or light brown sugar
1 to 2
small
Thai chiles
, finely chopped
1/2
cup
raw
unsalted cashews
1
small
red onion
, finely sliced
3/4
cup
diced pineapple
1/2
cup
packed
roughly chopped fresh cilantro leaves
1 large
duck breast
, about
1
pound
Kosher salt
and freshly ground black pepper
Directions
To Make the Dressing:
Whisk together lime juice, fish sauce, sesame oil, sugar, and chile in a small bowl. Set aside.
Serious Eats / Joshua Bousel
Place cashews in a small cast iron skillet over medium heat. Toast until fragrant and lightly browned, about 4 minutes. Transfer to a medium bowl. Add onion, pineapple, and cilantro; toss to combine. Set aside.
Serious Eats / Joshua Bousel
Light one chimney full of charcoal.
When all charcoal is lit and covered with gray ash, pour out and arrange coals on one side of charcoal grate. Set cooking grate in place, cover grill and allow to preheat for 5 minutes.
Clean and oil
the grilling grate. Score duck skin diagonally every 1/2-inch. Season breast liberally all over with salt and pepper. Place duck breast on hot side of grill, skin side down, and cook until skin has browned and crisped, 5 to 7 minutes. Flip and brown on other side, about 4 minutes. Move duck to cool side of grill, cover, and continue to cook until an instant-read thermometer registers 130°F (54°C) when inserted into middle of breast. Remove duck from grill and let rest for 5 to 10 minutes.
Serious Eats / Joshua Bousel
Thinly slice duck, halving any long strips into bite-size pieces. Add duck into bowl with pineapple mixture. Pour on dressing and toss to combine. Transfer to plates and serve immediately.
Serious Eats / Joshua Bousel
Special Equipment
Charcoal grill
,
chimney starter
,
instant-read thermometer
